long: Meaning: properly, to "front", i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to "manifest"; figuratively, to "announce" (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to "expose", "predict", "explain", "praise".  Usage: bewray, × certainly, certify, declare(-ing), denounce, expound, × fully, messenger, plainly, profess, rehearse, report, shew (forth), speak, × surely, tell, utter.  Source: a primitive root;
